Get person


		Sign u

"""Notes to myself

.ents retruns entities, which comes with the attributes .text and .label_"

"""

'Notes to myself\n\n.ents retruns entities, which comes with the attributes .text and .label_"\n\n'

def remove_whitespace_entities(doc):
    doc.ents = [e for e in doc.ents if not e.text.isspace()]
    return doc

nlp.add_pipe(remove_whitespace_entities, after='ner')

#count characters and organizations and include label
def count_characters(filepath):
            #open and read file with spacy
            tokens = nlp(open(filepath).read())
            #get the file name
            filename = os.path.split(filepath)[-1].replace(".txt","")
            filename = filename.replace("-"," ")
            #get a list of tuples with people/organizations and entity label
            people = [(item.text, item.label_) for item in tokens.ents if item.label_ == 'ORG' or item.label_ == 'PERSON']
            #clean up the people/organization names by getting rid of plurals, linebreaks, and some punctuation
            if len(people) > 0:
                people = [((re.sub('([0-9])|’s|’|—|\.|\n*', '', person[0])), person[1]) for person in people]
                #get rid of people/organizations that begin with lowecase letters unless they start with 'the' or 'and'
                people = [(person[0], person[1]) for person in people if re.match('(^[a-z])', person[0]) == None or re.match('^(the)', person[0]) != None or re.match('^(and)', person[0]) != None]
                #change people/organizations names to title case
                people = [(person[0].title(), person[1]) for person in people]
                #count tuples
                people_counts = Counter(people)
                    # make datalist for pandas dataframe
                #datalist = [(filename, people[0], people[1], people_counts) 
                 #           for ((people[0], people[1]), people_counts) in people_counts.items()]
                datalist = [(filename, people_counts[0][0], people_counts[1]) for people_counts in people_counts.items()]
                tmp = pd.DataFrame(datalist)
                tmp.columns = ['vignette','person','weight'] 
                return tmp
            else:
                return 

filepaths = sorted(glob.glob('/Users/melaniewalsh/dissertation/draft/3.Cisneros/other-materials/digital/vignettes/*.txt'))
characters_df = pd.DataFrame()
for filepath in filepaths:
    characters_df = characters_df.append(count_characters(filepath))

filepaths = sorted(glob.glob('/Users/melaniewalsh/dissertation/draft/3.Cisneros/other-materials/digital/vignettes/*.txt'))
for filepath in filepaths:
    filename = os.path.split(filepath)

filepaths = sorted(glob.glob('/Users/melaniewalsh/dissertation/draft/3.Cisneros/other-materials/digital/vignettes/*.txt'))
for filepath in filepaths:
    filename = os.path.split(filepath)[-1].replace(".txt","").strip()
    print(filename)

characters_df = characters_df.replace('I', 'Esperanza')

characters_df = characters_df.replace('Meme', 'Meme Ortiz')

characters_df_by_match.groupby(['person']).sum().sort_values(by='weight', ascending=False).to_csv('Mango-Characters-2.csv')

mango = pd.read_csv('Mango-Characters.csv', delimiter='\t')

mango2 = pd.read_csv('Mango-Characters-2.csv', delimiter='\t')

tokens = nlp(open('The-House-on-Mango-Street-No-Blank-Lines.txt').read())
    #get the file name

sample = '12 fjakdlaf;j'

re.match('(^[0-9]+)', sample).group()

'12'

#count characters and organizations and include label
def count_characters_by_match(filepath):
    #open and read file with spacy
    tokens = nlp(open(filepath).read())
    #get the file name
    filename = os.path.split(filepath)[-1].replace(".txt","")
    filename = filename.replace("-"," ")
    story_number = re.match('(^[0-9]+)', filename).group()
    filename = re.sub('(^[0-9]+)', '', filename)
    filename = f'{filename} ({story_number})'
    #get a list of tuples with people/organizations and entity label
    character_list = [person for person in mango2['person']]
    character_list.append('I')
    character_list.append('me')
    people = [item.text for item in tokens if item.text in character_list]
    #clean up the people/organization names by getting rid of plurals, linebreaks, and some punctuation
    if len(people) > 0:
        people_counts = Counter(people)

                # make datalist for pandas dataframe
            #datalist = [(filename, people[0], people[1], people_counts) 
                     #           for ((people[0], people[1]), people_counts) in people_counts.items()]
        datalist = [(filename, people_counts[0], people_counts[1], story_number) for people_counts in people_counts.items()]
        tmp = pd.DataFrame(datalist)
        tmp.columns = ['vignette','person','weight', 'story_number'] 
        return tmp
    else:
        return

filepaths = sorted(glob.glob('/Users/melaniewalsh/dissertation/draft/3.Cisneros/other-materials/digital/vignettes/*.txt'))
characters_df_by_match = pd.DataFrame()
for filepath in filepaths:
    characters_df_by_match = characters_df_by_match.append(count_characters_by_match(filepath))

characters_df_by_match = characters_df_by_match.replace('I', 'Esperanza')

characters_df_by_match = characters_df_by_match.replace('me', 'Esperanza')

characters_df_by_match.sample(40)

character_list = [person for person in mango['person']]

character_list.append('I')

character_list.append('me')

characters_df_by_match.to_csv('Mango-Character-By-Match.csv')
